Html:
Hi,

We have compiled the latest version of Chirpy Console today (203d711e4f12 - Feb 4 at 6:37 PM) (we were running on release ver 2.01 before), and now the mash.chirpy.config file we have isn't being picked up at all. 

We have a batch file that gets executed on build which references chirpy and the folder the mash.chirpy.config file is in. After compiling the latest version and running chirpy, the mash file isn't 'parsed':

 

C:\dev\Scripts>chirpy\Chirpy.exe chirpy
C:\dev\Scripts>pause
Press any key to continue . . .

Before it looked like this:

C:\dev\Scripts>chirpy\Chirpy.exe chirpy
ConfigEngine -- chirpy.org\mash.chirp.config

C:\dev\Scripts>pause
Press any key to continue . . .

What can have caused this? And is there someway to otherwise force it from the prompt? Trying to reference the file itself causes an error:

C:\dev\Scripts>chirpy\Chirpy.exe chirpy\mash.chirp.config
Unhandled Exception: System.IO.IOException: The directory name is invalid.

Thanks in advance!

Rich

Work in test environment.

Valid you configuration is really .chirp.config for config file.

Send full sample (zip file) .

Hi, I have uploaded a .rar file: http://www.safarinow.com/af/chirpytest.rar.

I have changed the mash.chirp.config file to have a small test in it. You will see that if you run the batch file it will execute chirpy, but it won't read the mash file (just edit the .bat file to resemble the right folder on your machine)
Were you able to look at the file? I've had no luck here...
